. The world’s population is expected to become
older, more urbanised and live in smaller households
Growing mobility and population are linked to human migration, a powerful
driver of changes in land and resource use patterns at decadal timescales, with the dominant
eing from rural areas to urban settlements over the past few decades, notably

by institutions and policies (e.g. agricultural subsidies and low

Research and development are central to forest restoration strategies that have become increasingly
important around the world as costs vary depending on methods used, from natural regeneration
with native tree species to active restoration using site prep
In addition, climate change poses the challenge about tree species selection in the future.
